chinese: (fml.) make sth. publicly known, esp. after it has been kept secret 透露；揭露；泄露
examples: e.g. The spokesman of the company refused to [[disclose]] more details of their latest project to the press.

chinese: (old ~ ) (infml. not polite) an offensive word for an old man 老家伙；老东西
happening or existing in many places, and therefore not special or unusual 常见的；屡见不鲜的
examples: e.g. With the improvement of people's living standard, foreign travels have become [[commonplace]].

chinese: [C] a thing that replaces sth, esp. because the first thing is old, broken, etc. 替代品；替换物
examples: e.g. Just two months ago, he underwent hip [[replacement]] surgery that cost $120,000.

chinese: officially get rid of a law, system, practice, etc. 废止；废除；取消
examples: e.g. It was only at the very end of the 19th century that this practice was [[abolished]].

chinese: stop sth. from being active, either temporarily or permanently 暂停 ; 中止
examples: e.g. We have decided to [[suspend]] all production at the factory until safety checks can be carried out.

chinese: [C] sb. who believes that good things will happen 乐观者；乐观主义者
examples: e.g. He's an eternal [[optimist]]. He always expects good things to happen or things to be successful.

chinese: deliberately make sth. such as a feeling or an activity last longer 延长，拉长，拖长（感觉或活动）
examples: e.g. Doctors say these new drugs can reduce pain and [[prolong]] life for two or three years.

chinese: 1) (only before noun) existing now, and needing to be dealt with quickly 目前的；当下的；紧迫的
examples: e.g. Let's try and solve the most [[immediate]] problems before they get worse.；e.g. If the eyes are affected by the drug, you must seek [[immediate]] medical attention.

chinese: 2) happening or done at once and without delay 立刻的；即刻的
examples: e.g. Let's try and solve the most [[immediate]] problems before they get worse.；e.g. If the eyes are affected by the drug, you must seek [[immediate]] medical attention.

chinese: 1) difficult or impossible to afford or understand 得不到的；难懂的
examples: e.g. The language of teenagers is often completely [[inaccessible]] to the elderly.；e.g. A long flight of stairs made the center of the museum [[inaccessible]] to disabled visitors.

chinese: 2) difficult or impossible to reach 难到达的 ; 不可及的
examples: e.g. The language of teenagers is often completely [[inaccessible]] to the elderly.；e.g. A long flight of stairs made the center of the museum [[inaccessible]] to disabled visitors.

chinese: treat a person or group differently from another in an unfair way （不公正地）区别对待，歧视
examples: e.g. Caulfield claimed the company had [[discriminated]] against him because of his nationality.

chinese: [C] 鞭子
in a way that is similar to, typical of, or relates to young people 年轻地；像年轻人地；具有年轻人特点地
examples: e.g. Melania believes that dressing [[youthfully]] is about keeping up with trends.

chinese: 1) strong and healthy 强健的；精力旺盛的
examples: e.g. Cutting the bush back in the autumn will help promote [[vigorous]] growth in the spring.；e.g. According to a recent survey, a quarter of people over 12 get no [[vigorous]] exercise at all.

chinese: 2) using a lot of energy and strength or determination 强度大的；积极的
examples: e.g. Cutting the bush back in the autumn will help promote [[vigorous]] growth in the spring.；e.g. According to a recent survey, a quarter of people over 12 get no [[vigorous]] exercise at all.

chinese: having old-fashioned attitudes and ideas — used to show disapproval 古板的，守旧的（含贬义）
examples: e.g. Tim was rude, unable to bear criticism, and more and more [[hidebound]] in his views as he got older.

chinese: bring back the same feelings or qualities that you experienced in the past 使重温；使再次经历
examples: e.g. I would say the film successfully [[recaptured]] the joyful atmosphere of those days.

chinese: [C] a working life in which you have several different jobs at one time, or a series of different kinds of job 组合型职业
examples: e.g. There is a trend toward more temporary employment and [[portfolio]] careers.

chinese: in a way that is suitable for a particular situation or that is based on what sb. has done or said 相应地
examples: e.g. It is said that the new employee has broken the rule and will be punished [[accordingly]].

chinese: [C] (BrE labourer) sb. whose work needs physical strength, for example building work 体力劳动者；工人
examples: e.g. Matthew has worked as a [[laborer]] in factories and on construction sites since he left his hometown.

chinese: [C] sb. whose job is to keep and check financial accounts, calculate taxes, etc. 会计师；会计
examples: e.g. People setting up business on their own really need to employ an [[accountant]].

chinese: [C, U] the act of guessing about the possible causes or effects of sth. without knowing all the facts, or the guesses that you make 猜测；推测
examples: e.g. There has been a great deal of [[speculation]] about what will happen after the president resigns.

chinese: 1) an unpleasant or difficult situation that is difficult to escape from 牢笼；困境
examples: e.g. Don't fall into the [[trap]] of investing all your money in one place.

chinese: 2) （捕捉动物的）夹子，罗网，陷阱
examples: e.g. Don't fall into the [[trap]] of investing all your money in one place.

chinese: continuing forever and having no end 永远的；永恒的
examples: e.g. Three teenage girls took a vow (誓言) of [[eternal]] friendship during the summer of 1985.

chinese: (cause to) dry and die 枯萎；干枯
examples: e.g. It is a pity that the spring flowers were already beginning to [[wither]].

chinese: [C] 蝉
warn sb. that sth. might be dangerous, difficult, etc. 警告；告诫；提醒
examples: e.g. The business report released on Wednesday [[cautioned]] investors against over-optimistic expectations.

chinese: (infml.) very good, esp. in a way that makes you feel happy and excited 极好的；极棒的
examples: e.g. The actress who played the fashion designer in the movie was absolutely [[terrific]]!

chinese: force sth. into a small space 把···塞进（小空间）；硬塞
examples: e.g. You have to be realistic — it's difficult to [[cram]] everything into a tight schedule.

chinese: succeed in dealing with a difficult problem or situation （成功地）应付，对付
examples: e.g. Some parents feel that they have got to the stage where they aren't able to [[cope]] on their own.

chinese: not able to live forever 不会长生不死的；终有一死的
examples: e.g. Her father's death reminded her that she was [[mortal]], and it made her very sad.

chinese: [U] the state of living forever or being remembered forever 永生；长存；永恒
examples: e.g. Some people want to achieve [[immortality]] through their works.

chinese: [C] sb. who often has fantasies, or who confuses fantasy and what is real 幻想家；空想家；不切实际者
examples: e.g. He is neither a liar nor a [[fantasist]], and he is careful about what he says.

chinese: a list of things that you want to do before you die 人生心愿清单
examples: e.g. Traveling to the Potala Palace in Tibet has been on my [[bucket]] list for years.

chinese: etc.
examples: manage to avoid death or a very bad situation even though it seemed that you would not be able to 死里逃生；逃脱厄运等
column4: e.g. Could you explain to us how you [[cheated]] death at every stage of the journey?

chinese: no longer young, and therefore no longer attractive or good at doing things 不再年轻；人老珠黄
examples: e.g. Kathleen thinks she's [[over]] the [[hill]], but she's only 32.

chinese: available to be bought, chosen, or used 可买到的； 供使用的；提供的
examples: e.g. Activities [[on]] [[offer]] at the beach include sailing, rowing, canoeing and camping.

chinese: arriving or happening soon 即将到达（发生）
examples: e.g. Economists agree that the economic situation is good and recovery is [[on]] the [[way]].

chinese: (BrE be on the cards) seem likely to happen 很可能发生
examples: e.g.- So you think they'll get married next year? - I think it's in the [[cards]].

chinese: become damaged and useless, or make sth. like this, by using it a lot or for a long time 用坏 ;（使）磨损
examples: e.g. I bought a pair of boots three years ago and they are beginning to [[wear]] out.

chinese: start a business 开业
examples: e.g. Dr. Rosen closed his downtown practice and [[set]] up [[shop]] in a suburban neighborhood.

chinese: if sth. such as a quality, disease, or skill runs in the family, many people in that family have it （某种品质、疾病、技能等）在家族中遗传，是家族特征
examples: e.g. All the three kids of the Thompsons are good musicians. The musical talent seems to [[run]] in the [[family]].

chinese: sb. who has the whip hand is in a good position because they can make other people do what they want 支配权；控制权
examples: e.g. During the last decade, the right wing of the party has held the [[whip]] [[hand]] over the country.

chinese: make sth. more complete, esp. by adding another feature （尤指通过增加另一特点而）使更加完美，彻底完成
examples: e.g. The feedback is that more research and solid evidence are needed to [[round]] out the article.

chinese: prepare a written document, such as a list or contract 起草，拟定（名单、合同等）
examples: e.g. Local authorities have [[drawn]] up guidelines on waste treatment and disposal.
